A bounded line-slice parallel to Unknown identifier `M`M through a relative interior point yields boundary endpoints whose segment contains that point.

Theorem 18.4. Let Unknown identifier `C`C be a closed convex set which is neither an affine set nor a closed half of an affine set. Then every relative interior point of Unknown identifier `C`C lies on a line segment segment sorry sorry : Set ?m.1segment Unknown identifier `y`y Unknown identifier `z`z joining two relative boundary points (here Unknown identifier `ri`ri C/Unknown identifier `rb`rb C are formalized as euclideanRelativeInterior (n : ) (C : Set (EuclideanSpace (Fin n))) : Set (EuclideanSpace (Fin n))euclideanRelativeInterior/euclideanRelativeBoundary (n : ) (C : Set (EuclideanSpace (Fin n))) : Set (EuclideanSpace (Fin n))euclideanRelativeBoundary).

theorem exists_mem_segment_of_mem_euclideanRelativeInterior {n : } {C : Set (EuclideanSpace (Fin n))} (hCclosed : IsClosed C) (hCconv : Convex C) (hC_not_affine : A : AffineSubspace (EuclideanSpace (Fin n)), (A : Set (EuclideanSpace (Fin n))) = C) (hC_not_closedHalf_affine : (A : AffineSubspace (EuclideanSpace (Fin n))) (f : (EuclideanSpace (Fin n)) [] ) (a : ), f 0 C = (A : Set (EuclideanSpace (Fin n))) {x | f x a}) : x : EuclideanSpace (Fin n), x euclideanRelativeInterior n C y z : EuclideanSpace (Fin n), y euclideanRelativeBoundary n C z euclideanRelativeBoundary n C x segment y z := by intro x hxri have hCne : C.Nonempty := by exact x, (euclideanRelativeInterior_subset_closure n C).1 hxri have hnotconv : Convex (euclideanRelativeBoundary n C) := not_convex_euclideanRelativeBoundary_of_not_affine_not_closedHalf (n := n) (C := C) hCclosed hCconv hCne hC_not_affine hC_not_closedHalf_affine obtain x, x, hxrb, hxrb, hxx, y, hyri, hyseg := exists_two_rb_points_with_ri_point_on_openSegment (n := n) (C := C) hCclosed hCconv hnotconv let M : AffineSubspace (EuclideanSpace (Fin n)) := AffineSubspace.mk' x (Submodule.span {x - x}) have hMbdd : Bornology.IsBounded ((M : Set (EuclideanSpace (Fin n))) C) := by exact isBounded_inter_line_of_rb_endpoints_with_ri_point (n := n) (C := C) hCclosed hCconv hxrb hxrb y, hyri, hyseg have hxC : x C := by have : x C \ euclideanRelativeInterior n C := by simpa [euclideanRelativeBoundary_eq_diff_of_isClosed (n := n) (C := C) hCclosed] using hxrb exact this.1 have hxC : x C := by have : x C \ euclideanRelativeInterior n C := by simpa [euclideanRelativeBoundary_eq_diff_of_isClosed (n := n) (C := C) hCclosed] using hxrb exact this.1 have hMne : ((M : Set (EuclideanSpace (Fin n))) C).Nonempty := by have hxM : x (M : Set (EuclideanSpace (Fin n))) := by simp [M] exact x, hxM, hxC have hv : v : EuclideanSpace (Fin n), v 0 v M.direction v (affineSpan C).direction := by refine x - x, ?_, ?_, ?_ intro hzero apply hxx exact (sub_eq_zero.mp hzero).symm have : x - x Submodule.span ({x - x} : Set (EuclideanSpace (Fin n))) := Submodule.subset_span (by simp) simpa [M] using this have hxA : x affineSpan C := (subset_affineSpan (k := ) (s := C)) hxC have hxA : x affineSpan C := (subset_affineSpan (k := ) (s := C)) hxC have hvsub : x - x (affineSpan C).direction := (affineSpan C).vsub_mem_direction hxA hxA simpa [vsub_eq_sub] using hvsub exact exists_rb_endpoints_for_bounded_parallel_line_slice_through_ri (n := n) (C := C) hCclosed hCconv M hMbdd hMne hv hxri
